intro: Ditremexa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ditremexa, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
